Description:
The FHIR CarePlan resource is a broad container for summarizing the plan of treatment for a patient. This resource is designed for stating specific activities related to a single patient, rather than generic protocols for condition treatment.

This read interaction enables the lookup of a specific encounter-level CarePlan resource by FHIR ID.
SampleResponse:
<CarePlan xmlns="http://hl7.org/fhir">

<id value="el6Q1sKg9RrZBWdUk9X-naQiXYPas6o3F23yfoGV6eas3" />

<text>

<status value="generated" />

<div xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml">

<h1>Patient Instructions</h1>

<p>

<pre>Patient Instructions: Come back at least once a year.</pre>

</p>

<h1>A&P Notes</h1>

<h2>Note:</h2>

<p>

<pre>Patient has foot pain when standing. Referred patient to orthopedics.</pre>

</p>

</div>

</text>

<status value="active" />

<intent value="proposal" />

<category>

<coding>

<system value="http://hl7.org/fhir/us/core/CodeSystem/careplan-category" />

<code value="assess-plan" />

<display value="Assessment and Plan of Treatment" />

</coding>

<text value="Assessment and Plan of Treatment" />

</category>

<category>

<coding>

<system value="http://snomed.info/sct" />

<code value="734163000" />

<display value="Encounter Level" />

</coding>

<text value="Encounter Level" />

</category>

<subject>

<reference value="Patient/exkr5BRhovpIY4hqjnmTPNQ3" />

<display value="Argonaut, Jason" />

</subject>

<encounter>

<reference value="Encounter/e.12qt.AQ6RbFrXDDLRUMMhnSXkBmVmgz0e2o2tX42WU3" />

</encounter>

<note>

<text value="Assessment and Plan Note: Patient has foot pain when standing. Referred patient to orthopedics." />

</note>

<note>

<text value="Patient Instructions: Come back at least once a year." />

</note>

</CarePlan>

ID.Name: ID
ID.Description: FHIR identifier for a CarePlan resource.

CarePlan.Name: CarePlan
CarePlan.Description: An instance of the R4 CarePlan resource.

category.Name: category
category.Description:
Type of plan. 734163000 should be used to search for encounter-level CarePlans.

In addition, category type "assess-plan" is always included in search results.

encounter.Name: encounter
encounter.Description: The encounter or episode of care associated with this CarePlan.

intent.Name: intent
intent.Description: For encounter CarePlans, this always equals "proposal".

note.Name: note
note.Description: The note(s) associated with this encounter-level CarePlan.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient or subject of this care plan.

text.Name: text
text.Description: The note(s) associated with this encounter-level CarePlan formatted as an XHTML fragment.
